page.title: 03BARLASTON -EDUCATION
page.content: The{Wedgewood Memorial College situated in{Barlaston Village}is celebrating this year its 40th anniversary of providing residential {adult educational courses}for a wide variety of interests and organisations. It is governed by a committee drawn from Staffordshire Education Authority,Keele University Adult Education Department, and the Workers Education Association.These three organisations provide most of the courses during the year,but the college is also used by other groups such as trade unions and school parties,when space and time permits. Many of the courses are open to anyone who wishes to attend and those for 1985 include Architectural Photography,Painting,Esperanto and preparation for retirement.
